content.description:
Starts behind the oak tree below an undercut lip. Grab the overhead lip and press out a mantle with not much for your feet.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.protection: pad, spotter to keep you out of the tree
content.location: Right side of the north face

content.description:
Balance up on small holds to start and then romp up the gradually easier but tall slab. A good problem for beginners or children with a low crux right off the ground and then much easier climbing above.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right up the middle of the obvious slab on the east face.

content.description:
Sit start at a thick flake and work the sloping arete out right to finish with an undercut mantle. Short but quality.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.protection: Pad, maybe a spotter for the mantle finish
